title: Sierra Leone Crowned Champions Of The 2025 WAFU A Women Cup
body_text:
Sierra Leone Crowned Champions of the 2025 WAFU A Womenâ€™s Cup
- History made in Mauritania! Sierra Leoneâ€™s womenâ€™s national team lifted the 2025 WAFU A Womenâ€™s Cup after a hard-fought 1-0 win against Senegal in a thrilling final.
- A proud night for Sierra Leone and womenâ€™s football across West Africa!.
What a night for Sierra Leone! The nationâ€™s female football team, fondly known as the Sierra Queens, etched their names in history after clinching the 2025 WAFU A Womenâ€™s Cup in Mauritania.
In a tense final showdown against Senegal, both teams battled fiercely with the first half ending goalless. The match was packed with energy, tackles, and near misses, but it was Sierra Leone who broke the deadlock in the second half to secure a memorable 1-0 victory.
Salamatu Kamara (#7) was named Woman of the Match for her outstanding performance, leading from the front and inspiring her team to glory. The atmosphere was electric, and the celebrations at full-time reflected what this triumph meant to the players, fans, and the entire nation.
It wasnâ€™t just about the trophy â€” it was a statement for womenâ€™s football in Sierra Leone and West Africa. The Sierra Queens have shown the world whatâ€™s possible with passion, teamwork, and belief.
